column2: ITP approved for use by: Pradeep Talasila
Acceptance Criteria - 25MPa concrete to be used as per IFC drawings.
Verifying Documents - Supplier Certificate of Compliance
Acceptance Criteria - All Steel must comply with Australian Standards.
○ Bollard sizes must be checked on site.
Method - Document review, Visual and Measure
Verifying Documents - Supplier Certificate of Compliance
Acceptance Criteria - Survey to set out the following but not limited to: existing services, bollard locations
○ Offset checked against the running edge prior toinstallation of bollards.
Acceptance Criteria - Excavation for bollard foundation must not undermine footing of existing structures.
○ Follow asset owners guidelines for work around their service.
○ Excavation must use Non Distructive Digging in the rail corridor
Acceptance Criteria - All bollard foundations to be inspected by the site team prior to installing the bollards. All foundations are to be free of water and loose material.
○ If the ground material on site does not meet the design assumptions, the Geotechnical Engineer shall be notified to determine if design change is required.
— Footing dimension 650mm deep, diameter of min 350mm
Acceptance Criteria - Maximum post spacing to be 1650mm ctr
○ Max. Bollard height 900mm above ground level.
Verifying Documents - This ITP, Delivery Dockets
Acceptance Criteria - 8mm HDG Chain, with max 300mm sag
○ 40mm hole in bollard, chain to be secured via 120x12mm HDG Hex Head Bolt
Acceptance Criteria - Bollards are to be checked for verticality and ensure offset is not less than required from near face of post to centreline of track or as shown on alignment drawings.

On behalf of Metropolitan Roads Program Alliance, it is hereby certified that the Works represented by the item of work listed have been tested in accordance with the Project Quality Plan and conform in all respects with the requirements of the Contract.
ITP approved for use by: Pradeep Talasila
Acceptance Criteria - 20 MPa concrete to be used as per IFC drawings.
2.2 - Steel components including posts, wires and fittings
Acceptance Criteria - All Steel must comply with Australian Standards.
○ Steel section sizes must be checked on site.
Method - Document review, Visual and Measure
Verifying Documents - Supplier Certificate of Compliance
Acceptance Criteria - Survey to set out the following but not limited to: existing services, and fence start and end points.
○ Offset checked against the running edge prior to installation of posts.
Acceptance Criteria - Excavation completed by auger outside of service working limits.
○ Follow asset owners guidelines for work around their service.
Acceptance Criteria - All post foundations to be inspected by the site team prior to installing the posts. All foundations are to be free of water and loose material.
○ If the ground material on site does not meet the design assumptions, the Geotechnical Engineer shall be notified to determine if design change is required.
○ Strainer Post to be 2300mm, with min 1100mm embedment into concrete footing, max height to be 1150mm above FSL.
○ 1x Stay attached to strainer post approximately 400mm from top of post, to be 3000 to 3600mm long (As per manufacturers specification) and secured into the ground via a concrete anchor block.
○ Strainer Post to be 2300mm, with min 1000mm embedment into concrete footing, max height to be 1150mm above FSL.
○ 2x Stay's attached to strainer post approximately 400mm from top of post, to be 3000 to 3600mm long (As per manufacturers specification) and secured into the ground via a concrete anchor block.
○ Double Strainer assembly required at intervals not exceeding 200 metres.
Verifying Documents - This ITP, Concrete Dockets
Acceptance Criteria - Intermediate Posts to be 1800mm long, with Min. 650 embedment into the ground, Max. height to be 1150mm above FSL
○ Intermediate Posts to be spaced every 6900mm, every third post
○ 2.no Star Picket evenly spaced between Intermediate posts, 1800mm long with Min. 650 embedment into the ground, Max. height to be 1150mm above FSL.
○ Bottom wire hole location to be located within 25 to 100mm of FSL
Acceptance Criteria - Footing only required at Strainer Posts.
Verifying Documents - This ITP, Concrete Dockets

Acceptance Criteria - 2 No. 1.6dia High tensile barbed wire at the second and forth wires, 5 No. 2.5dia High tensile plain wire in all other locations. Wires are to spaced approximately 150mm apart (In accordance to SD3102).
○ Wires shall be tightened and securely fastened to strainer posts.
○ Chain shall be tightened and securely fastened to posts at max. 400 crs and tension wires at max. 500 intervals with 2.5 dia. galv. tire wire or clips.
Acceptance Criteria - Posts are to be checked for verticality and ensure spacings do not exceed standards.
Acceptance Criteria - Ensure that any NCRs pertaining to the lot / element / Work area that this ITP covers, have been closed.
Frequency - Once, prior to closure of this lot / element / Work area

On behalf of Metropolitan Roads Program Alliance, it is hereby certified that the Works represented by the item of work listed have been tested in accordance with the Project Quality Plan and conform in all respects with the requirements of the Contract.
